CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression -{General} (Article 10-1 - Freedom of expression)
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s son - in - law , PERSON , owns a construction company . In DATE he built a villa for GPE , a prominent politician , former prosecutor and deputy in the NORP parliament .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant wrote a letter to PERSON – the chief editor of a television programme ( “ GPE dla reportera ” ) . She stressed in particular :

“ For DATE PERSON has owed MONEY to a small construction company . On DATE ] he moved into a villa built by this company and until DATE , DATE , he has not paid MONEY . No one can help us . The deputies from the “ PERSON and ORG ( Prawo i sprawiedliwość ) do not reply to our letters , they are silent because how could they touch the great W. They believe in his lies and fibs , no one is persuaded that he owes MONEY ( PLN ) to poor , hard working people ( ... ) .

My son - in - law had contacts with different investors , but this is the first time in his life that he met such a greedy and mendacious person . He never expected such dishonesty from a public person DATE a deputy from the PERSON and ORG . This is why he [ GPE ] managed to trick him out of such a significant sum . ”

CARDINAL . In a second letter , dated DATE , addressed to the President of the board of ORG , the applicant expressed the view that the media forgot about small enterprises that went bankrupt as they could not afford to pay the costs of civil proceedings . She further stated that :
“ PERSON managed to deceive and ruin CARDINAL [ ... ] NORP companies and to successfully intimidate their owners and employees . ”
CARDINAL . PERSON was informed about both letters by NORP Television journalists , who asked him for his comments .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON lodged a private bill of indictment against the applicant . He charged the applicant with defamation . In particular , PERSON submitted that in the letters sent to NORP Television on DATE and DATE the applicant had wrongly alleged that he had not paid PERSON ’s company . The applicant had also referred to his using words indicating dishonesty , deceitfulness and fraudulent actions on his part .

CARDINAL . The applicant was tried by ORG . On DATE she was convicted of defamation under LAW . The criminal proceedings against her were conditionally discontinued and she was ordered to pay ORG MONEY to GPE She was also ordered to publish a written apology . In addition , the applicant was ordered to reimburse ORG CARDINAL to GPE for the costs of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . NORP The trial court held that the content of the letter and in particular the expressions used , such as “ liar ” , “ greedy and mendacious person ” , “ dishonest ” could have resulted in GPE losing the public trust necessary for his political career . The background of this case was a civil dispute between ORG and GPE over the villa that the latter had built . The court noted that both parties had their arguments , more or less justified , but it was not the court ’s role to adjudicate on this conflict , since its final outcome was already before a civil court . The court further referred to expert evidence ( several opinions ) obtained in the criminal and civil proceedings from which it appeared that indeed part of GPE ’s allegations against PERSON as regards the quality of the construction works was substantiated . More importantly , the villa was not a faultless construction as claimed by the applicant and her family .

CARDINAL . The court further held that it was impossible to accept that the words used by the applicant were true . They gave the applicant ’s private opinion about PERSON , which had no objective justification in the facts of the case . In addition , the court noted that the applicant could not have been mistaken about the genuineness of her statements as she was well aware of the civil dispute between PERSON and GPE The court also observed that the evidence before it had not confirmed in any way that CARDINAL companies had been ruined .

CARDINAL . In the court ’s opinion the applicant ’s letters formed an unjustified personal attack on PERSON The applicant consciously circulated untrue facts concerning an alleged non - compliance with a financial obligation between PERSON and PERSON The allegations concerned the private life of GPE and therefore could not be protected in the same way as statements concerning his political activities .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against her conviction . On DATE ORG partly upheld the first - instance judgment . However it ordered the applicant only to publish an apology and reimburse PERSON ’s costs . The court referred to the reasons given by ORG . It considered that the applicant ’s allegations were not true and the applicant had been aware of this . Furthermore , she had not acted in the public interest but had presented her personal negative and unsubstantiated opinion of GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE J.D. lodged with ORG a claim against PERSON and his wife seeking payment of MONEY for the works carried out by his company .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in a summary procedure ( postepowanie uproszczone ) ordered PERSON and his wife to pay PERSON the requested sum together with interest .
CARDINAL . On the GPE appeal the case was transferred to the ordinary procedure .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment and dismissed PERSON ’s claim . The court held that the plaintiff ’s claims were unsubstantiated since , as proved by expert opinions , the construction works carried out by his company had been faulty . In addition PERSON had had to spend MONEY in order to repair the building . The court concluded that ORG could have requested to have this amount offset against ORG claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the firstinstance judgment and dismissed PERSON ’s claim .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Criminal Code provides in so far as relevant :

“ § CARDINAL . Anyone who imputes to another person , a group of persons , an institution , a legal person or an organisation without legal personality , such behaviour or characteristics as may lower this person , group or entity in public opinion or undermine public confidence in their capacity necessary for a given position , occupation or type of activity , shall be liable to a fine , a restriction of liberty or imprisonment not exceeding one year .

§ CARDINAL . NORP If the perpetrator commits the act described in paragraph CARDINAL through the mass media he shall be liable to a fine , a restriction of liberty or imprisonment not exceeding two years . ”
Article CARDINAL provides as follows :
“ § CARDINAL . The offence specified in LAW is not committed , if the allegation made in public is true .

§ CARDINAL . Whoever raises or publicises a true allegation in defence of a justifiable public interest shall be deemed not to have committed the offence specified in LAW CARDINAL or CARDINAL ; if the allegation regards private or family life evidence of truthfulness shall be admitted only when it serves to prevent a danger to someone ’s life or to prevent the demoralisation of a minor . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , ruling on a legal question referred to it by ORG , declared LAW compatible with ORG DATE read in conjunction with LAW . The court found that in some circumstances the protection of rights and freedoms like dignity , good name and privacy might prevail over the protection of freedom of expression . The ORG further found that there was no basis to assume that protection of personal rights through the civil law alone would be equally effective as criminal law . Protection of personal rights by means of the criminal law did not by itself infringe the relevant provisions of LAW .
